column1: I improved at using the system over time
I always looked directly at my final target, holding the same gaze throughout an episode
I compensated for flaws in the system by changing my gaze over time (e.g., by exaggerating looking in certain directions)
Please describe your input strategy
column2: When the robot is close to the goal, gaze at some middle point between robot and goal; when robot is faraway from goal, gaze at some point that goes beyond the goal in the goal direction.

column1: Any other feedback?
column2: The robot does not seem to be adapting the actions to my changing gaze (at least not much).

column2: Almost always look to the right of the goal; the farther the goal is, the farther the gaze will be from the goal as well.

column1: Any other feedback?
column2: I need to admit that I am a bit biased by the name "no right" and I might not find the (correct?) pattern that quickly without that hint.

column2: Look at a point slightly beyond the goal in the goal direction and adjust the gaze location according to robot behavior.

column1: Any other feedback?
column2: Sometimes the robot responds very well to my gazes (better than phase 2), but at some other times it just does not seem to be aware of that at all (similar to phase 1). Also I need to admit that I got tired over time and might not have provided as accurate input as in the previous phases.
